seed.event: US-China Phase One Trade Agreement signed
seed.context: The US and China sign a partial trade deal, pausing escalation of tariffs after a two-year trade war.

levels.parent_event: US-China Phase One Trade Agreement signed
path: US-China Phase One Trade Agreement signed
US removes sanctions on COSCO Shipping Tanker (Dalian)
levels.research_summary: OFAC removed sanctions on COSCO Shipping Tanker (Dalian) 16 days after Phase One signing, explicitly attributed to US-China government discussions around the trade agreement.

candidates.event: US removes sanctions on COSCO Shipping Tanker (Dalian)

seed.event: First U.S. COVID-19 case confirmed
seed.context: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 in the United States is reported in Washington state.

levels.parent_event: First U.S. COVID-19 case confirmed
path: First U.S. COVID-19 case confirmed
First U.S. clinical trial for remdesivir COVID-19 treatment begins
levels.research_summary: The first U.S. clinical trial for remdesivir - one of the earliest experimental COVID-19 treatments - began at Nebraska Medical Center on February 6, 2020, directly responding to the first confirmed U.S. case and emerging pandemic. This Phase 3 trial was specifically documented in ClinicalTrials.gov records as starting 17 days after the initial confirmed case.

candidates.event: First U.S. clinical trial for remdesivir COVID-19 treatment begins

levels.parent_event: First U.S. clinical trial for remdesivir COVID-19 treatment begins
path: First U.S. COVID-19 case confirmed
First U.S. clinical trial for remdesivir COVID-19 treatment begins
NIH announces preliminary remdesivir trial results showing faster recovery
levels.research_summary: The National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) announced preliminary results from the Adaptive COVID-19 Treatment Trial (ACTT) showing remdesivir-treated patients had 31% faster recovery time compared to placebo, marking the first clinical evidence of therapeutic efficacy against COVID-19 in the U.S.

candidates.event: NIH announces preliminary remdesivir trial results showing faster recovery

seed.event: Hong Kong national security law enacted
seed.context: China imposes a national security law on Hong Kong, criminalizing secession, subversion, terrorism, and collusion with foreign forces.

levels.parent_event: Hong Kong national security law enacted
path: Hong Kong national security law enacted
U.S. Treasury imposes sanctions in response to Hong Kong security law
levels.research_summary: The U.S. Department of the Treasury announced sanctions on July 24, 2020, directly responding to China's implementation of the Hong Kong national security law. This action was part of broader measures to address concerns about erosion of Hong Kong's autonomy.

candidates.event: U.S. Treasury imposes sanctions in response to Hong Kong security law

levels.parent_event: U.S. Treasury imposes sanctions in response to Hong Kong security law
path: Hong Kong national security law enacted
U.S. Treasury imposes sanctions in response to Hong Kong security law
China imposes sanctions on 11 U.S. citizens including senators in response to Hong Kong sanctions
levels.research_summary: China's Foreign Ministry announced sanctions against 11 U.S. citizens, including Senators Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz, in direct retaliation for U.S. sanctions related to Hong Kong's national security law. This occurred 6 weeks after the U.S. Treasury's initial sanctions.

candidates.event: China imposes sanctions on 11 U.S. citizens including senators in response to Hong Kong sanctions

seed.event: GameStop short squeeze peaks

path: GameStop short squeeze peaks
House Financial Services Committee hearing on GameStop/Robinhood market events
levels.research_summary: Congressional hearing held 3 weeks after GameStop peak to examine market manipulation, brokerage restrictions, and systemic impacts of the short squeeze event. Directly referenced GameStop situation and involved key players (Robinhood, Citadel, Reddit).

path: Afghanistan falls to the Taliban

levels.research_summary: A Qatari technical team landed in Kabul on September 1, 2021 to help restore airport operations after the Taliban takeover disrupted international infrastructure. This marked the first international technical assistance to the new regime.

US removes COSCO Shipping Tanker (Dalian) from OFAC sanctions list
levels.research_summary: On January 31, 2020, the US Treasury Department officially delisted COSCO Shipping Tanker (Dalian) from sanctions, explicitly noted as a result of Phase 1 trade agreement negotiations between US and Chinese governments. This occurred 16 days after the Phase One signing.

International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses officially names the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2
levels.research_summary: The virus causing COVID-19 was formally classified and named SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses, following scientific characterization of the pathogen responsible for the initial cases including the first U.S. infection.

candidates.event: International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses officially names the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2

path: First U.S. COVID-19 case confirmed
International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses officially names the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2
Publication of first major study documenting neurological manifestations in COVID-19 patients
levels.research_summary: The April 2020 issue of Critical Care Explorations featured one of the first comprehensive studies linking SARS-CoV-2 infection to neurological complications, published exactly 2 months after the virus received its official name. This peer-reviewed research directly used the SARS-CoV-2 nomenclature and established clinical understanding of COVID-19's systemic effects.

candidates.event: Publication of first major study documenting neurological manifestations in COVID-19 patients

US Treasury imposes sanctions on Hong Kong officials under the Hong Kong Autonomy Act

This action was authorized by President Trump's Executive Order implementing the Hong Kong Autonomy Act.

This marked the first international technical assistance to the new regime.

path: Russia invades Ukraine
Mariupol city council reports 2,187 civilian deaths from Russian bombardment
levels.research_summary: Mariupol city officials reported at least 2,187 civilian deaths from Russian aerial bombing and artillery strikes by March 12, 2022, with approximately 100 aerial bombs dropped on the city since invasion began. Residential areas including apartment buildings were specifically targeted.

seed.event: Elon Musk acquires Twitter
seed.context: Elon Musk completes a $44 billion acquisition of Twitter after months of legal and financial disputes.

levels.parent_event: Elon Musk acquires Twitter
path: Elon Musk acquires Twitter
Elon Musk warns Twitter employees about possible bankruptcy
levels.research_summary: At a company-wide meeting on November 10, 2022 (reported November 12), Elon Musk told Twitter employees bankruptcy was a possibility if the company didn't achieve positive cash flow, citing $13 billion debt from acquisition and advertising revenue declines. This marked the first explicit bankruptcy warning after acquisition.

candidates.event: Elon Musk warns Twitter employees about possible bankruptcy

Major COVID-19 outbreaks overwhelm hospitals in Shanghai
levels.research_summary: Following the abrupt end of China's zero-COVID policy, Reuters documentation shows major outbreaks overwhelmed Shanghai hospitals by late December 2022, with empty streets and strained healthcare systems evident in visual evidence from December 23.

candidates.event: Major COVID-19 outbreaks overwhelm hospitals in Shanghai

seed.event: Trump convicted on 34 felony counts in hush money trial
seed.context: Former President Donald Trump found guilty on all 34 counts of falsifying business records related to hush money payments to Stormy Daniels. First criminal conviction of a U.S. president.

levels.parent_event: Trump convicted on 34 felony counts in hush money trial
path: Trump convicted on 34 felony counts in hush money trial
New York's top court declines to hear Trump's appeal of gag order in hush money case
levels.research_summary: New York Court of Appeals rejected Trump's attempt to challenge the gag order imposed during his hush money trial, a direct post-conviction legal development. This occurred 19 days after his May 30 conviction.

candidates.event: New York's top court declines to hear Trump's appeal of gag order in hush money case

path: Biden withdraws from 2024 presidential race
Kamala Harris selects Tim Walz as vice presidential running mate
levels.research_summary: Kamala Harris formally introduced Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz as her vice presidential running mate at a Philadelphia rally on August 6, 2024, following Biden's withdrawal. This marked the first major campaign restructuring after Harris became the Democratic nominee.

candidates.event: Kamala Harris selects Tim Walz as vice presidential running mate

seed.event: Telegram founder Pavel Durov arrested in France
seed.context: French authorities arrest Telegram CEO at Paris airport over allegations platform enables drug trafficking, money laundering, child abuse distribution by refusing content moderation. Held for 4 days.

levels.parent_event: Telegram founder Pavel Durov arrested in France
path: Telegram founder Pavel Durov arrested in France
EU announces new social media regulations targeting encryption and data localization
levels.research_summary: European regulators announced stricter social media regulations on September 9, 2024, specifically targeting encrypted messaging platforms like Telegram following Durov's arrest. Measures included mandatory data localization and backdoor access requirements for law enforcement.

candidates.event: EU announces new social media regulations targeting encryption and data localization

seed.context: Strict liability framework for AI harms, requiring explainability for high-risk systems. Passed 401-192 in Parliament.

path: EU passes AI Liability Directive

seed.event: Hezbollah pager explosions kill dozens across Lebanon

path: Hezbollah pager explosions kill dozens across Lebanon
October 2024 Iranian strikes on Israel
levels.research_summary: Iran launched missile and drone strikes against Israel on October 1, 2024, directly responding to Israeli actions against its Hezbollah proxies in Lebanon. The attack killed 4 Palestinians, 2 Israelis, and injured 40+ people, while damaging military infrastructure. This marked a major escalation in the Iran-Israel conflict following the Hezbollah pager bombings.

seed.event: Trump wins 2024 presidential election in decisive Electoral College victory
seed.context: Donald Trump defeats Kamala Harris, winning all swing states for 312 Electoral College votes. Republicans gain Senate control. Democrats retain narrow House majority. Trump becomes second president to serve non-consecutive terms.

levels.parent_event: Trump wins 2024 presidential election in decisive Electoral College victory
path: Trump wins 2024 presidential election in decisive Electoral College victory
Special Counsel Jack Smith drops election subversion and classified documents cases against Donald Trump
levels.research_summary: On November 25, 2024, Special Counsel Jack Smith dismissed federal charges against Trump related to election subversion and classified documents, following Trump's electoral victory and anticipated presidential immunity. This was reported by CNN as a direct consequence of the 2024 election outcome enabling Trump to influence Justice Department actions.

candidates.event: Special Counsel Jack Smith drops election subversion and classified documents cases against Donald Trump
